bug.short_desc: Links are unclickable in Slashdot comments

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.2a1pre Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.2a1pre
All links in user comments on slashdot are unclickable. Left button and middle button click on any link simply does nothing. (Clicking the right button and selecting "Open Link in New Tab" works)
Reproducible: Always

Isn't really in the mood to dig through minified js, so haven't looked at it down to exactly where. But from the look of it, it looks like its a website js causing the problem, cause if you disable javascript the links work fine.

I can reproduce the bug with a clean profile and: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
And Chromium behaves the same: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.204 Safari/534.16
And I can reproduce the bug on Windows XP as well, even with IE8: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0)
Ah, then it's clearly a Slashdot problem. Closing the bug, sorry for the noise.
